Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The normative process says that every case starts with Receive order Then the next step must be Check inventory After checking inventory there are two possible paths 1 If inventory is sufficient Check inventory Authorize payment Package items Ship order Close order 2 If inventory is insufficient Check inventory Cancel order Close order Key constraints from the description Authorize payment must come after Check inventory and before Package items Package items must come after Authorize payment and before Ship order Ship order must come after Package items and should never occur after Cancel order Close order must be the final activity in all cases

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Package items Ship order Close order This looks perfect It follows the path for sufficient inventory No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Receive order Check inventory Package items Authorize payment Ship order Close order Here Package items happens before Authorize payment According to the normative description payment should be authorized before packaging So this is a violation The description says Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Cancel order Ship order Close order This is problematic After Cancel order they tried to Ship order The description says that after cancellation you should go directly to Close order and not do any fulfillment activities like shipping Also Authorize payment happened before cancellation which might be okay if they checked inventory and found it insufficient but then why authorize payment The description says that if inventory is insufficient you should cancel directly after checking inventory without authorizing payment So authorizing payment before cancellation is also a violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Receive order Check inventory Cancel order Close order This follows the insufficient inventory path perfectly No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Ship order Close order Here Package items is missing The sequence goes from Authorize payment directly to Ship order According to the description items must be packaged before shipping So this is a violation

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Let me summarize the violations Case 2 Package items before Authorize payment Case 3 Authorize payment before Cancel order which shouldnt happen if inventory is insufficient and Ship order after Cancel order Case 5 Missing Package items step before Ship order

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now let me explain each violation with references to the normative description For Case 2 The normative description states that Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging Here packaging happened before authorization For Case 3 The description says that if inventory is insufficient after checking inventory you should go directly to Cancel order Authorizing payment shouldnt happen in this path Also after cancellation you shouldnt have any fulfillment activities like shipping For Case 5 The description states that Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping Here shipping occurred without the packaging step
